reviews.text:
This is one of the great parks in Shanghai.
I stayed just accross the park and did my running on the mornings and rewlly enjoyed the landscape. It even has black swan !
Very nice well maintained clean par close to the center. In the weekend families gather with tents to protect from the sun, it has a good vibe and is a big park also good for joggers.
It was a bit crowded during a sunny weekend. But it's such a perfect place to walk around.
It is Largest park in Shanghai. Not a lot of food options though but I love it!
Lots of walking trails, waterfront edges, and sports and picnic fields for all.

data.formatted_address: 88 Shi Ji Da Dao, Lujiazui, Pu Dong Xin Qu, China, 200120
data.name: Jin Mao Tower

reviews.text: I had the pleasure of admiring the Jin Mao Tower with its unique facade. It adds a touch of charm to Shanghai's skyline, standing out amidst the surrounding buildings. Whether viewed from afar or up close, its architectural beauty is undeniable. Staying at both the W Hotel and EDITION Hotel suites provided me with spectacular views of this tower, enhancing my appreciation for its architectural charm.

We went up at the Jin Mao Tower which was right beside the Shanghai Tower to see the view of the Bund and the cityscape of Shanghai. This building has a viewdeck at the topmost floor. Upon entering the lift, there is a photo booth for groups and individuals. You can claim your photos if you decide to buy the printouts on your way down at the exit. The elevator was very fast and like most viewpoint towers, it has a souviner shop and an interactive game booth on the same level. The building has a hollow core where you can see the cafe at the bottom. The view was really nice that day. The sky was a bit cloudy. There were a lot of tourists when we visited but not crowded. There were areas where you can just sit and enjoy the view. It is always nice to see the city from above.

The Jin Mao Tower, situated in the heart of Shanghai's Lujiazui financial district, is a masterful blend of architectural prowess and functional elegance. Soaring to a height of 421 meters, this skyscraper commands attention with its distinctive tiered design, reminiscent of ancient Chinese pagodas, yet infused with a modern aesthetic.

Upon entering the tower, visitors are greeted by a grand atrium that spans several floors, adorned with intricate details and luxurious materials. The tower's interior seamlessly combines traditional Chinese design elements with contemporary touches, creating a sophisticated ambiance.

Riding the express elevators to the observation deck on the 88th floor is a thrilling experience, offering panoramic views of the sprawling cityscape, the Huangpu River, and the neighboring skyscrapers. The architectural ingenuity is evident in the tower's structural design, incorporating advanced engineering to withstand earthquakes and typhoons common to the region.

One of the Jin Mao Tower's unique features is its multi-functional nature. Housing a luxury hotel, offices, and observation decks, it serves as a microcosm of urban living, making it a symbol of Shanghai's economic and cultural dynamism. The tower's integration of sustainable practices further underscores its commitment to environmental responsibility.

In summary, the Jin Mao Tower is more than a towering structure; it's a testament to architectural innovation, cultural fusion, and urban functionality. Its enduring appeal lies not only in its height but in its ability to seamlessly integrate tradition and modernity in the vibrant tapestry of Shanghai's skyline.

The 3rd tallest tower in Shanghai. There is observation deck on 88 floor. Ticket price is 120 RMB for adult. Very quick elevator delivers you to the deck within several seconds. I assume that it could be some crowds during weekend. If you want to be closer to the sky, you can visit Shanghai Tower that is in 50 meters nearby.

The tower itself and the view is nice.
I have tried Skywalk experience, my third skywalk.
Unfortunately, i was very disappointed about the service. Zero English and very unfriendly to foreigners (was in a Chinese group).
It is very commercial, they care more about quantity than quality.
However, you can take amazing pictures with spectacular views, which you can get in digital form for not too high price.

data.formatted_address: 2000 Shi Ji Da Dao, Pu Dong Xin Qu, Shang Hai Shi, China, 201204
data.name: Shanghai Science and Technology Museum

reviews.text: To learn the past, current and future of Shanghai. The city which is poised as the gateway of China to the world with the state of the art systems designed by the people and for the people. The city reinvents itself through innovation and challenge and at the same time conserving the the people's rich culture. The city is self healing and self sustaining. A true masterpiece of architecture and life. The city has big plans for its future and incorporates plans for the Young and old.

Great shopping area with everything you'd want from clothing to electronics. One vendor though ripped off my coworker for a model airline airplane charged $65 when is was available for $25 from Dave and Cindy's shop. Shop and bargain! The best shop for airline crew looking for electronics or clothing (Lululemon) is Dave & Cindy at A-19 and A-20. Best for Football jerseys is Jersey City D3-65 ($25 for NFL jersey)

DO NOT GO TO D1-13 Carey shop they would not return or refund the airplane model and yelled at us saying it was better quality. IT WAS NOT!

Shanghai Science and Technology Museum is a large museum in Pudong, Shanghai, close to Century Park, the largest park within the inner districts of the city. It is one of China's most-visited museums. It received 1,351,000 visitors in 2020, despite a fall of attendance of 72 percent from 2019 due to restrictions and reduced tourism imposed by the COVID-19 pandemic.

This museum is closed permanently almost before covid and its not yet opened. I visited on 22nd Oct 2023. But it was closed. Some construction work in going on. Please call them before you plan to go.

However you can visit this area, enjoy garden scenery, shopping underneath metro station. Use your negotiation skills.

If you like the technology and scientist, this place is good for you. Better come to this place with your children coz it was fun with them. They can learn scientist on this place. The most museum i like was the zoology section. I like the animal zone from around the world and the tropical forest.

data.formatted_address: 2266 Gong He Xin Lu, Zhabei Qu, Shang Hai Shi, China, 200072
data.name: Shanghai Circus World

reviews.text: The Shanghai circus and acrobatic show was an absolute marvel! From start to finish, it was a breathtaking display of skill, strength, and artistry. The performers captivated the audience with their daring feats and jaw-dropping stunts. The choreography was seamless, the music was exhilarating, and the atmosphere was electric. It was an unforgettable experience that left me in awe. I would highly recommend this show to anyone looking for an extraordinary evening of entertainment. 5/5 stars!"

Shanghai Circus World is a must-visit attraction for anyone who loves the circus or wants to experience the beauty and excitement of traditional Chinese circus arts. It's an unforgettable experience that will leave you in awe of the human body's capabilities and the magic of the circus.

Enjoy :)

If you respect animal rights you won’t enjoy Happy Circus. Selling the tickets was misleading (at least in English), we thought we are going to a very different kind of show. We had to leave in the middle of the show when they brought a bear in chains to stage. It is disgraceful that this circus is for kids. The show made us sad and angry.

This show was awesome!  The quality of the acrobats is top-notch (I've seen these kinds of shows in other places in the world, including Las Vegas, and this one ranks right up there). Although the seats aren't cheap, there isn't a bad seat in the house so you don't have to buy the most expensive one to have a good view. There was a good variety of things going on - bicycle stunts, contortionists, acrobatics of course, and the metal ball full of motorcycles. As an adult I really enjoyed it but kids of all ages (not babies, obviously) would love it!
It is great show and so impressive,  I would highly recommend it to people who are not experienced on it.

data.formatted_address: 4MV5+945, Pudong, Shanghai, China, 201205
data.name: Shanghai Disneyland Park

reviews.text: The place is magical yes. But the waiting time for each ride or entertainment is horrible. There is hardly any public seating in the park and crowd management is very poor. Each show is not worth having to wait for 50 to 60 minutes as it lasts for only around 10 minutes. It doesn’t have all the characters but shopping at the stores is really good and prices are compatible cheaper to the other disnleyland locations that I have been to. Please purchase your tickets in advance and opt for premium aces or gravely reduces waiting time and queues even the early bird access is amazing

As the tagline says it is the happiest place on earth. It was a great weather when I visited. It was cold with a warm sun.

Download the app to see the waiting time of the rides. It was so accurate and we just plan accordingly based on the waiting time.

Great night time show, second one preferably since it was that crowded anymore.

Came two days in a row. Finished most of the rides within two days. Came early for the first day and a lot of people was rushing to enter the park.

Came on a weekday and the queue wasn’t that bad compared to the one in Japan. Would advise to buy tickets in advance before coming, redemption was easy and tickets were printed on the spot, just show them your booking QR code. Queues are manageable and didn’t really needed to buy the express pass. There’s a Disney village right outside the park and there were lots of food options! Also, the tron theme was incredibly well done! We will return to shanghai Disney land again.

Wonderful place to be....the rides are for all group ages and they ate free once you pay for the entry ticket...and the toy shops and candy shops are worth a visit but everything is too pricey if you're a foreigner and your currency is different. It's a big place and there is so much to do and see so reach there as soon as it opens so you can make the best of your visit. Also there was hours of wait for each ride even on a working day...that makes the experience tiring. The parade in the evening and the light and fireworks show at 8:00p.m night ate worth seeing.. so amazing. It's a lifetime experience to visit disney.

Very crowded. Expensive food and beverages.
The rides are fun and some are really exciting!!!
Good to spend an entire day.
Magical if you grew up with Mickey and Donald!!!

reviews.text: This is not a history museum, there are no artifacts here. It is actually a wax museum depicting the old shanghai and its glory of the old days. A fashionable and forward city even in 1920s. Worth a look if u have the time. This wax museum is not a building by its own. It is INSIDE the DONG FANG MING CHU tower at the basement. Entrance is free as part of the tower tix and tour.

I am quite impressed with the museum size. I thought it would be a quick overview of the Shanghai but it has some interesting insights of the city in the past, present and future. Maybe more English descriptions for non-Chinese speakers
This is inside Shanghai TV Pearl Tower, basically for Art, artifacts, documents & photos illustrating the history of Shanghai.
The position on google map is totally wrong. It's far away on the other side of the river.

Excellent museum showing how the Bund and surrounding areas of Shanghai has changed and developed over the years from pre to post colonial times. Lots to see and read. You can easily spend over 90 minutes here. Worth purchasing a ticket to the pearl tower with  museum entry included.

data.formatted_address: 7565 Bo Yuan Lu, Jia Ding Qu, Shang Hai Shi, China, 215332
data.name: Shanghai Auto Museum

reviews.text: Very interesting place! There is a very interesting play station for younger kids as well.

Well curated museum and lots of information as long as you get a guide. Without a guide you're just looking at the eye candy. It's in the middle of nowhere if you are staying in downtown Shanghai so it may be a trek. If you love cars though, it's worth a visit. Although imyou may have seen all these cars before with the exception of the China specific cars.

Visited in February 22, on a Sunday. Started to get busy in the afternoon, but quiet in the morning. The museum shows great samples well preserved  historical cars from different countries. It is definitely worth a visit if you like history of transportation. You also get a glimpse of what Shanghai looked 100 years ago for transport , roads and traffic.

Car museum located in the Anting Shanghai International Auto City area. Definitely a must see if you are interested in cars especially classic cars. 60 RMB for an adult ticket.
Open Tuesday-Sunday 9:30am to 4:30pm. Closed earlier in the day than expected so take note to get there earlier. I easily spent over 3 hours browsing the 3 floors of cars and information.
First floor has the history of the automobile from the wheel to the first diesel engine, auto transmission, and assembly line. Lots of cool stuff to see.
Next floor has a history of the automobile in China.
3rd floor is comprised of antique classic car collections and an extended range of miniature car models.
On the top level there is a learning and discovering area for children and adults which teaches you about how cars work and the parts of the car (engine combustion cycle, transmission, suspension, steering, etc.) All of the children's stuff is in Chinese however. Also F1 racing simulators on this level.
There is a gift shop by the entrance that sales lots of miniature car models.
Great if you can occupy yourself, not many guide options and only restroom I saw was on the top floor.
Definitely check it out for the classic cars alone.
One of the best example of automotive history I’ve been to. A fantastic blend of history of the car in China evolved as well as many international examples. Well worth the visit.

reviews.text: Very beautiful building, some nice collections​ on the first floor, other 2 floors are mainly small shops. It's worth a visit if it's on your way.
They have a nice cafe where you can get discount after buying entrance ticket. Second and third floor of Museuma are amazing. There is pretty nice terrace with a view.
Good to visit if you have extra time
Worth it just to look inside the beautiful building, but the art is a good selection of traditional crafts, too.
An enjoyable pit stop while exploring the French Concession area. Not a ton of stuff to look at and little of what’s there was made before the 1960s, but definitely worth the paltry admittance fee.

reviews.text: Small yet interesting museum worths a visit, especially if you are looking for a place somewhere silent to avoid crowd of Nanjingdonglu.

There was NO art in this museum.
It was way beyond the contemporary art.  If you want to call it an art, maybe like an applied art?
Waste of 100 Yuan for the entrance fee. Too expensive for nothing.
Relatively small but beautiful with taste design museum!
Nice to see some displays from up and coming artists.  Some of the video displays are quite useful as both a visual spectacle, and as a learning tool for when I work on my mandarin.

Nice little art museum + great architecture building ! I fell in love with this little art museum, the arts exhibitions are on 5 floors, big space + good lightning, the last floor is a small coffee + a terrace with a nice view on Shanghai skyline, you will just love it. The cost is only 15 rmb, you should consider visit it, if you love art + architecture like me, enjoy !

data.formatted_address: China, Shang Hai Shi, Pu Dong Xin Qu, Huan Hu Xi San Lu, 交界处 CN 上海市 浦东新区 临港大道 和 邮政编码: 201308
data.name: Shanghai Planetarium

reviews.text: If you love astronomy, it is a must see. Don’t miss it. Incredible all you can see and how it is showed, the building and exhibitions (some Chinese moon rovers and the Tiangong Laboratory module). You need Wechat and Chinese number to buy the tickets, it is allowed only three days in advance. You can visit all museum with two or three hours if you take your time, without the films you can watch in the planetarium.There is a restaurant with pasta, pizza and so on (the food is ok). Also, there are several shops with nice space souvenirs. The only bad thing is the schedule, closing at 16h is too early (the main shop at 16:20)

It is a magnificent place to learn Astronomy knowledge for adults and kids. It not only covers western astronomy but also Chinese one which is rarely accessible in other Astronomy museums in the world. The museum has three main exhibitions: Homeland, Cosmos and Journey. Homeland is about our galaxy. Cosmos is more about the physics behind the universe. Journey section intends to tell the history of human exploration of the universe. I didn’t have the chance to visit all three exhibitions because too much to see! I would love to visit again to finish all sections. The cafe in the museum is very interesting. They sell galaxy inspired candies and drinks. I even got a latte that has my astrological sign on it ! The museum seems a major education center for kids. So a lot of students! You also need to reserve the tickets online (through WeChat). You can choose either morning or afternoon visitation (12:30pm-4:30pm). It is a very popular place and tickets are sold quickly. It is about 1 hour drive from the city center.
Very nice place as well as amazing feel and theme. Definitely recommended for tourists interested in astronomy like me, and it’s sort of like a museum. :D

This was an interesting afternoon - the Planetarium has many interesting things to read and look at if you are interested in space. It is not what I'd call a "planetarium". There is no place to sit and stair up at a starry sky like in planetariums in the west. It is a walk through type museum. It was quite busy when we were there, full of many kids (as you may expect). Outside there is a nice little walking park and the building is very impressive.
Great museum, definitely worth a visit for ppl interested in astronomy 👍

Visited here to see the mysterious Sanxingdui ancient relics. The special exhibition only runs for a limited time. And the museum self was very new and was on test run. Only limited areas were open.
And you must register and book the tickets through WeChat. It’s super popular and better book days in advance

A museum with old relics transversing centuries.  Bronze Age to Iron Age of China. History buff favourite.
Foreign visitors, bring passport to get ticket.

2 stars for the building architecture. Everything else is disappointing. Overcrowded, most exhibits not open yet, very limited food options (mainly cakes and basic pastries) and the opening exhibition Sanxingdui is overhyped, underwhelming and excessively commecialised.

data.name: Dongping National Forest Park

reviews.text:
All stars for nature. Staying in Shanghai for a long time could be oppressing. This Park could be an ideal escape from the city. You can easily use public bus with that cost only 22 RMB (have yet to count your transportation fee to the main bus station). If you are students, remember to bring student cards (even if you are from non-Chinese universities, they just check the graduation dates). The entrance tickets for students are 30 RMB (prettt affordanle for efforts to plan more trees!)

Bike renting process annoys us a lot. My friend and I are both foreigner. We only have alipay as a payment method. Eventhough the banner does show accepting alipay. Staff said they only accept Wechat pay. We could not do that as we don’t have Chinese accounts. If we want to use Alipay, we have to deposit 200 RMB for each bike, which does not apply to people who pay with Wechat Pay. Anyways, we decided to walk cause we kinda felt weird. Exploring the park by walking turns out pretty good; we will stopped by places a bit more easily.

Walking and exploring half of the park takes us around 1 hour and a half. If you bike, you can go around the park in 1 hour (that what the staff said, but probably you will not see the nitty gritty).

Enjoy your trip! Cheers!

reviews.text: Terrific place to come and get custom clothing made! I heard great things about Rita and Rita (Stall 130) and decided on them. I had 3 suits made and they were came out amazing. Lining, stitching, and overall fit were spot on and Rita was extremely friendly and spoke great English. Price wise they were extremely honest and fair. Definitely reccomend if you're in the area!

Exceptional Tailoring Experience at Suits by Susan, Fabric Market Shanghai!

I recently had the pleasure of visiting Suits by Susan at Fabric Market Shanghai, and I must say, it was an outstanding experience! Sofie and her colleagues provided top-notch service, ensuring that every detail was meticulously taken care of.

What impressed me most was the exceptional quality of their tailoring, rivaling the best in Bangkok, Thailand - and at a competitive price point! The team's proficiency in both English and Chinese made communication seamless, putting this foreigner at ease.

Sofie's expertise and guidance helped me create a bespoke suit that exceeded my expectations. The attention to detail, the precision, and the final product's quality were all truly impressive.

If you're in Shanghai and seeking a reliable, skilled, and affordable tailor, look no further than Suits by Susan. Sofie and her team will take care of you, ensuring a fantastic experience and a garment that will make you feel confident and stylish.

Highly recommended!

I visited Suits by Susan and was looked after by Wendy in Stall 233 which is on the 1st floor of the South Bund Fabric Market. They have 3 shop fronts here so don't worry if you see more than one Suits by Susan its not a copy. Wendy has more than 10 years experience in the Tailoring industry and was very helpful and knowledgeable from the start to the end. I was measured up and helped through the design process which is where Wendy's experience shone, she was able to help guide me with what works and what doesn't. I went back a 2nd time after the Suits, Shirts and Pants were completed to do a 2nd fitting, here we able to see the changes I wanted to make to get more of a slim fit style. They went away and made the alterations I wanted and I came back to do a final fitting. I was absolutely blown away by the end results, the quality, the fit and the styling, I've never put on a jacket that felt that good! In the end I made 3 Jackets, 4 Chinos, 6 Business Shirts and 1 pair of Suit pants. I'll definitely be ordering more! I can't thank Wendy, Susan and their tailors enough for everything.

Suits by Susan stalls 233, 269, & 271 did a great job for our wedding suit. Also done in 24 hours and you can have it delivered to your hotel. They also have English speaking staff, so communication is not a problem. If you want to order again, they keep the measurements of all their customers so you can just message them via wechat anytime.

I highly recommend store 271 Suits by Susan. I had a great shopping experience there and the entire team was super nice and helpful. I ended up buying three tailored suits including one vest and also four tailored shirts. Everything fits perfectly and according to my special requested fit.

reviews.text: After a long hiatus, due to the Pandemic, I was back in Shanghai to see old friends. I also wanted to buy several items that friends back home asked me for, and I knew that for that I had to go to the famous "Fake Mall". Having visited it in 2019 I expected big changes like many stores closed or less attractive merchandise. Nothing like that. Everything looks just like it did 5 years ago. I was tasked to buy some ornamental jewelry and also a pearl collar. After walking through I settled on 2 stores where I found some great selection and prices (after the customary haggling). For the first items it was Cathy Jewelry at B1-27 and for the pearls it was Lily Jewelry at F-6. Both ladies speak pretty good English and were more than helpful, really taking their time with me, even though other customers walked in. I guess when you treat people as people, with respect, and not just as sales persons, then you can expect to be treated the same way. They were so helpful even after the sale, one accompanying me all the way in that big mall to a shoe store that she recommended (they didn't have my size for the shoes where the shoe size is printed on them, like the picture) and the other lady walking me through the maze to a clean rest room. Both of them were so sweet. I told them I would come back on my next trip, even if it's just to have some tea with them.

Welcome to palika bazaar of China/Shanghai.
Sellers here can calculate the figures in Hindi. Interesting video attached . This is a fake market but quality wise the products looks ok.

Don't buy electronics products without checking as many of them are defective.

If you are a good negotiator then this is the right place for you!

A modern market located in the basement so for those of you who have never been there it may take a little more effort to find it.  The entrance to the mall is through several glass doors located in a garden and above them is the words 'AP Plaza.  ' When entering the glass door you have to go down several floors down where the stairs are also made of glass, which is very challenging.  But when you reach the mall there are lots of clothing sellers selling their products, apart from clothes, they sell various accessories such as hats, shoes, belts, bags and many more.  But you have to be clever at haggling over prices.

This is a Market like Palika bazaar of Delhi. All fake market. Electronic gadjets , watches , bags , suitcases clothes  you name it . There are about 500 shops and each one will lure you. They speak Hindi too as many Indian come here for Cheap purchases. You must have good skills for negotiation to ask for 10 percent rate and walk away. I have been here in 2019 and now last week. You can be choosy and can get some good things...Got a good Laptop bag ..Suitcase large size , some e gadjets.. U just feel good to negotiate and buy. At the end after a few days you always feel that I have paid more...but it's for a Dopamine high for a few days.!  There is a Starbucks and 7-11 shop too.  Locals do not know this market though !  Happy shopping

reviews.text: You can buy a lot of interesting things for little money. The trick is to negotiate with the sellers and you can lower the price several times.

The place to go in Shanghai for replica products. Fairly sizeable mall with small stands selling mostly clothes, watches, electrical trinkets. Definitely not as bad as people make it out to be. There will be bargaining and you will make some good and some bad deals. We paid around 15-25% of their original asking price, it's all part of the process and they're good sports about it, it's never personal and if you don't want to buy it then walk away. They will try to convince you to go in their stores but there was no following or nagging us, we strolled around for quite a while. Some brands or higher quality stuff is in secret rooms or hidden in compartments/roof. Basically only expats and tourists go here.

AVOID COCO STORE at all cost the seller will try to rip you off and sell you very bad quality stuff. We tried to get a refund from one of his bad quality projector (the next day) he refused and has threatened us and tried to make us go to a small room where god knows what could have happened to us. Avoid this store please for your safety. The market is full of other nice and welcoming shop.

Shanghai A.P. Xinyang Fashion market is a must-visit destination for fashion enthusiasts in the bustling city of Shanghai. From trendy outfits to traditional Chinese garments, this market offers a wide variety of fashion choices that cater to all tastes and preferences.

Upon entering the market, one is immediately greeted by the vibrant and lively atmosphere. The market is located in a spacious building with multiple floors dedicated to different types of fashion items. The layout is well-organized, making it easy for shoppers to navigate and explore the various stalls and boutiques.

What sets Shanghai A.P. Xinyang Fashion market apart from other fashion markets in the city is its extensive selection of clothing options. Whether you are looking for high-end designer brands or affordable streetwear, you are sure to find it here. The market is a treasure trove of unique and on-trend pieces, making it a favorite shopping destination for fashion-forward individuals.

The market also showcases a wide range of traditional Chinese garments, offering visitors a chance to immerse themselves in the rich culture and heritage of the country. From elegant qipaos to intricate silk embroidery, these traditional pieces are beautifully crafted and reflect the essence of Chinese fashion.

In addition to clothing, the market also boasts a variety of accessories, shoes, and bags to complement any outfit. Shoppers can mix and match their finds, creating stylish ensembles from head to toe. The market truly caters to all fashion needs and desires.

Another aspect that makes Shanghai A.P. Xinyang Fashion market worth visiting is its affordability. While some stalls offer high-end designer items at higher price points, there are plenty of options for those on a budget as well. Bargaining is also common here, allowing shoppers to secure great deals and discounts.

The market is easily accessible, located in the vibrant Xinyang neighborhood in Shanghai. It is well-connected by public transportation, making it convenient for both locals and tourists to visit. Additionally, there are several eateries, cafes, and shopping malls nearby, making it a perfect spot for a day of shopping, dining, and leisure.

Overall, Shanghai A.P. Xinyang Fashion market is a shopper's paradise, offering an extensive selection of fashion items, a vibrant atmosphere, and affordability. Whether you are a fashionista looking for the latest trends or an admirer of traditional Chinese garments, this market has something for everyone. Do not miss the opportunity to immerse yourself in the world of fashion when in Shanghai.

Subway is very nice way to get around, especially if you don't speak the language, taxi's will and do reject you for rides, be advised.

reviews.text: This 100+ stall market is a must visit for Hong Kong visitors.  I have been coming here each Hong Kong visit for the last 40 years.  Come here to see what they have to offer to get ONE piece of personal souvenir.  You may end up leaving with multiple purchases for your friends and relatives.  In Hong Kong, rent is the highest cost to the store operators.  Not here, this market property is owned by the government and the stall owners pay very little.  So, you can expect the lowest possible price, but only if they don't jack up the price to you.  So, compare shop.  Bargain if you feel you need to.  I have been buying from the same stalls for years.

Visited twice.
Enough sellers with beautiful wares.

Twice I have returned to Sandra (and Kelvin) stall number 152.

2 major reasons.
Her items are very tasteful and modernized into tasteful pieces of jewelry. Also if there are combinations that do not exist yet, she will create them for you. She also does traditional, but clearly she has noticed which sell better.
Secondly, she lets you look in peace without trying to bully/coerce you in an unpleasant way. It was not surprising to me that she had a lot of Westerners in her clientèle, on her WhatsApp and returning.

Kelvin is also a cool guy and runs 2 different stalls in the jade market.

Overall, there are many stalls with beautiful pieces, very photogenic and a large assortment of trinkets for use or souvenirs.

Authenticity is unbeknownst to me, especially between the different vendors. Sandra however definitely had qualitative products - stall 152

I will start off this review by saying I only went to see Sandra at Booth 152, based on all of the reviews on TripAdvisor, and Iwas not disappointed. I do not enjoy the haggling and negotiating of places like this so I was happy for all of the recommendations and made a beeline for her booth. She wasn't there that day, but her sister and her brother helped me out. They gave me great prices and even more discounts based on the quantity that I bought.

I sincerely appreciated The patient and friendly customer service and was in and out in less than 30 minutes.

Nice place to see all the jade items. You get Pearl's  and other kinds of beads. But beware, you need to bargain way lot. For example, I selected a chain which had HKD1350 tag on it. Without me bargain it she reduced it to HKD200. I finally bargained it to HKD100. If you are good at bargain, this will be your place for shopping.

This is an enormous monument with incredible views of Puxi and the Bund, and a bit of the north side of Suzhou River. It is beside the Garden Bridge and easy to access even with wheelchair or baby stroller with large ramps.

If you're wondering where some of the amazing, panoramic-looking shots of  Puxi are taken, this is it.

reviews.text:
The Shanghai World Financial Center (SWFC; Chinese: 上海环球金融中心; pinyin: Shànɡhǎi Huánqiú Jīnrónɡ Zhōnɡxīn, Shanghainese: Zånhae Guejieu Cinyon Tsonsin) is a supertall skyscraper located in the Pudong district of Shanghai. It was designed by Kohn Pedersen Fox and developed by the Mori Building Company, with Leslie E. Robertson Associates as its structural engineer and China State Construction Engineering Corp and Shanghai Construction (Group) General Co. as its main contractor. It is a mixed-use skyscraper, consisting of offices, hotels, conference rooms, observation decks, and ground-floor shopping malls. Park Hyatt Shanghai is the tower's hotel component, comprising 174 rooms and suites occupying the 79th to the 93rd floors, which at the time of completion was the highest hotel in the world. It is now the third-highest hotel in the world after the Ritz-Carlton, Hong Kong, which occupies floors 102 to 118 of the International Commerce Centre.

Source: Wikipedia

This place is free to visit and no entry fee. Easy access via Metro line no.8, getting off at China Art Museum Station.

We went to visit the museum early on a weekend and there was already a line when we arrived. We were just in time for the opening. The museum is a massive, unique and well-designed structure. It is easy to go around even for seniors. There are toilets , lifts/escalators and seats around the complex. The tour inside is very educational too. One of the highlights of this place is a giant digital screen replicating a long ancient scroll where the people in the painting can walk and talk. I dont really know how to describe it but it is a must- see when you get there. There is also a cafe and a souviner shop inside. Overall it was a good experience.

A massive and fascinating piece of architecture. It houses a large collection of contemporary art.

We went on a weekend so there were a lot of visitors but there was still enough room for everyone. Set aside at least half a day for this.

Absolute state of the Art Museum. Avoid a visit on the weekend. The Museum is large and there are exhibits from all historical time periods. A special highlight is the huge animated town picture from Ming Dynasty which allows an excellent virtual trip to rhe middle age.  You should purchase tickets in advance. The visit can be enriched with a bike tour alongside the Huang Pu river. The Museum is also attractive for Children.

The Shanghai Museum of Art stands as a captivating testament to the dynamic intersection of tradition and modernity in Chinese art. Nestled in the heart of Shanghai, this cultural haven beckons visitors with its expansive collection that seamlessly weaves together classical masterpieces and avant-garde expressions.

One of the museum's notable strengths lies in its ability to embrace the continuum of Chinese art, offering a comprehensive journey through time. Ancient scrolls and traditional ink paintings coexist harmoniously with contemporary sculptures and experimental installations. This juxtaposition creates a dialogue that transcends temporal boundaries, providing patrons with a profound understanding of China's artistic evolution.

The architectural design of the museum complements its artistic offerings. A harmonious blend of modern aesthetics and traditional Chinese elements, the building itself becomes a canvas for artistic dialogue. The interplay of natural light and innovative exhibition spaces enhances the immersive experience for visitors, fostering a connection between the art and its environment.

While the museum celebrates its rich heritage, it also serves as a dynamic platform for emerging artists, ensuring a vibrant representation of the contemporary Chinese art scene. The curation reflects a thoughtful balance, showcasing diversity in style, medium, and narrative.

In summary, the Shanghai Museum of Art is a cultural gem that not only preserves the essence of China's artistic legacy but also propels it forward into the realm of the contemporary. It stands as a testament to the enduring spirit of creativity, making it a must-visit for both art enthusiasts and those seeking a profound encounter with the cultural tapestry of China.

reviews.text: Great Museum!

It's a very good art museum. The exhibits are updated frequently, probably every two or three months. There are three floors and the area is not large. You can enjoy all the exhibits in about an hour. The quality is relatively high and it’s free.
The museum is closed!!!!

data.formatted_address: 685 Chang Jiang Xi Lu, Bao Shan Qu, Shang Hai Shi, China, 200441
data.name: Shanghai Museum of Glass

reviews.text: It's a perfect place for adults and children to spend their weekend. Here you can get an overview of how glass is produced in nature and the history of glass making by humans. Glass art from all over the world is on display in a number of galleries. All descriptions of the exhibits are in both Chinese and English. You need to buy tickets at the entrance. There is also a theatre next to the main building for kids to have fun and a shop which sells all kinds of glass products.
really big complex, come during the weekends for more special exhibits, expect to spend more than 90 mins here

The great one museum in Shanghai that must visit, its location is out from the downtown city but not too much far. The museum give much information about the glass - from early history to the present used of glass in many meanings as decorations, pieces of art, furniture as well. There's usually have the demonstration of making glass and DIY workshop for children and visitors, awesome place.

It's a pricey but ultimately worth it museum if you like to learn the science behind glass as well as see some nice art installations. 50 rmb for general admission and 50 rmb for the special exhibit. We'll worth the money IMO.

The BRKN special exhibit is very well curated. Each installation has an accompanying song (accessed using a QR code). The general admission isn't too shabby either.

Take a cab from the subway stop. Walking would take way too long.
Really nice excursion. Staff was super friendly and the displays were super well done. A must-see for design and architecture lovers.
